name: pretty-php
description: The opinionated formatter for modern, expressive PHP

pretty-php.formatterPath.description: Use a custom version of PrettyPHP

pretty-php.formatterArguments.markdownDescription: Pass additional arguments to PrettyPHP, e.g. `--one-true-brace-style`

pretty-php.formatting.simplifyStrings.description: Replace single- and double-quoted strings with whichever is clearer and more efficient

pretty-php.formatting.magicCommas.markdownDescription:
Explode arrays and arguments with a trailing comma into one item per line

```php
<?php
$arr = [
  'a',
];
```

pretty-php.formatting.blankBeforeReturn.description: Add a blank line before return and yield statements unless they appear consecutively or at the beginning of a compound statement

pretty-php.formatting.strictLists.description: Arrange items in lists horizontally or vertically by replicating the arrangement of the first and second items

pretty-php.formatting.alignment.alignAss.description: Align consecutive assignment operators and double arrows when they have the same context

pretty-php.formatting.alignment.alignCha.description: Align consecutive object operators in the same chain of method calls

pretty-php.formatting.alignment.alignFn.markdownDescription:
Align arrow function expressions with their definitions

```php
<?php
$obj->Callback = fn($value) =>
                     $this->receive($value);
```

pretty-php.formatting.alignment.alignLis.markdownDescription:
Align arguments and array elements with their enclosing brackets

```php
<?php
$obj->method($arg1,
             $arg2);
```

pretty-php.formatting.alignment.alignTer.description: Align ternary operators with their expressions

pretty-php.formatting.oneLineArguments.description: Suppress newlines between arguments in function declarations

pretty-php.formatting.preserveOneLineSta.description: Suppress newlines in statements and control structures that start and end on the same line, including individual case statements

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
